main event: A sighting of a flare-like light observed in Kettering, Ohio, on April 6, 1967.
interesting points: The observed light was much brighter than several stars and emitted pieces of fire that fell but were extinguished before reaching the ground., The phenomenon was described as resembling a round flare., The sighting occurred shortly after 10:20 PM and lasted approximately 3 minutes., The light was noted to move rapidly overhead, much faster than a jet plane., The sighting was reported to the U.S. Air Force as part of Project Blue Book.
witness description: Sophie K. Parr, 53, female, civilian, who reported the sighting.
